Key Arguments: The legislation poses a significant threat to free speech.
Individuals should have the freedom to access and evaluate information themselves.
Labeling information as misinformation/disinformation can be influenced by external factors such as monetary gain.
Past instances of information labeled as misinformation have later been proven correct.
The proposed powers of ACMA are seen as forceful and restrictive, lacking fairness and integrity.
Main Themes: Distrust in authority's ability to fairly label misinformation
Concerns about censorship and control of information
Notable Quotes: It is the greatest single threat to free speech in living memory.
Nobody should have the power to tell me what to see/believe or not to see/believe.
Most of the information on digital platforms over the past 3 years that was labelled ‘misinformation/disinformation’ has now been proven to be factual, honest, and correct.
This blatant attempt to control information that does not fit the narrative or ‘criteria’ is so obviously an attempt to threaten free speech once and for all in Australia.
